\begin{center}
\captionof{table}{Model complexity: $n$ is the number of training samples, $f$ the number of features, $n_{trees}$ is the number of trees.}
\begin{tabular}{|l|l|}
\hline
\textbf{Machine learning model} & \textbf{Training complexity} \\ \hline
Logistic regression & $O(nf)$ \\ \hline
SVM with linear kernel & $O(nf)$  \\ \hline
SVM with radial basis kernel & $O(n^2f)$  \\ \hline
Decision tree & $O(n^2f)$  \\ \hline
Random forest & $O(n^2fn_{trees})$  \\ \hline
XGBoost & $O(nfn_{trees})?$  \\ \hline
\end{tabular}
\end{center}
